+package org.triplea.generic.xml.scanner;
+
+import java.util.Optional;
+import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException;
+import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamReader;
+import lombok.experimental.UtilityClass;
+
+/**
+ * Searches for body tag content in a XML file (originally built to read 'game-notes'). This
+ * searches for a specific tag, with attribute key value pairs, then looks for a specific child tag
+ * underneath that and returns the tag body content.
+ */
+@UtilityClass
+class BodyTextScanner {
+
+  /*
+   Implementation notes:
+
+   This works by keeping track of state of whether we have found the parent tag and the child tag.
+   When we first see the parent tag with matching attribute name and value then we toggle
+   'foundParent' to true. When we find the child tag we'll toggle "foundChild" to true and
+   from there we'll buffer any body content that we find.
+
+   When we hit the end tag for the child we'll return the buffered content. If we hit
+   an end tag and "foundChild" is false, then the parent tag did not contain the desired
+   child tag and we flag "foundParent" to false and we keep searching for another parent
+   tag that matches, and then we'll search for a child tag and so on until we find something
+   or return empty if we never do find a match.
+
+  */
+  Optional<String> scanForBodyText(

timeline.bodyText: This class was moved and renamed so that it could be shared between the 'reader' and 'scanner' packages.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.message:
Add an XML Scanner, reads partial data from an XML

A utility that will replace "shallow parsing". Rather than having
a partially populated game data, we'll skip the game data assembly
and just return parts of the XML directly. Any consumers of this
will only get data fields and will *not* get a partial game data
object.

Use XML-Scanner in game-core to do shallow-parsing

The shallow-parsing is so we can find the game name of a XML file
without doing the full parse of XML and without assembling
a GameData object.

This update changes shallow parsing to use a new XML Scanner
(in xml-reader) that is based on StAX.

The performance change for Bot startup speed is negligable, but
for listing game files (clicking 'select map' button), there
is a pretty nice speedup and XML shallow parsing time is
reduced from on average 80ms (per XML) to 0.5ms

Forward-looking, future work will incorporate the XML body-text
scanner to read game-notes in a quick manner to speed up the listing
of game notes in the 'select game' screen.
